author: John Anthony
title: Serko offers bag tracking device
text:
Serko offers bag tracking device JOHN ANTHONY Last updated 17:14, September 8 2015 
Serko has released a bag tracker that allows travellers to see where their luggage is. 
Travel booking company Serko has released a bag tracker to help travellers keep a closer eye on their luggage. 
Serko chief executive Darrin Grafton said the bag tracker would allow Serko mobile users to know whether their bags made it onto the plane, or how far away it was from the luggage carousel. 
To use the tracker travellers place a small beacon in their luggage and pair it with the Serko mobile app using bluetooth. 
Up to three bags could be tracked simultaneously. 
Grafton said the tracker was easy to use and operated in two modes. 
The "find my bag mode" told users how far away their bags were and if they were within a range of up to 70 meters. 
"Carousel mode" alerted the user when their bag came into range on the carousel. 
The small bluetooth technology beacons lasted up to one year without being charged. 
Serko users would soon be able to purchase the tags online. 
A price for the tracker was yet be set but it is understood that it would be very low cost.
